title: 681-B
statement: B. Economy Gametime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputKolya is developing an economy simulator game. His most favourite part of the development process is in-game testing. Once he was entertained by the testing so much, that he found out his game-coin score become equal to0.Kolya remembers that at the beginning of the game his game-coin score was equal tonand that he have bought only some houses (for1 234 567game-coins each), cars (for123 456game-coins each) and computers (for1 234game-coins each).Kolya is now interested, whether he could have spent all of his initialngame-coins buying only houses, cars and computers or there is a bug in the game. Formally, is there a triple of non-negative integersa,bandcsuch thata× 1 234 567 +b× 123 456 +c× 1 234 =n?Please help Kolya answer this question.InputThe first line of the input contains a single integern(1 ≤n≤ 109) — Kolya's initial game-coin score.OutputPrint "YES" (without quotes) if it's possible that Kolya spent all of his initialncoins buying only houses, cars and computers. Otherwise print "NO" (without quotes).ExamplesInput1359257OutputYESInput17851817OutputNONoteIn the first sample, one of the possible solutions is to buy one house, one car and one computer, spending1 234 567 + 123 456 + 1234 = 1 359 257game-coins in total.

processed.result:
Given a positive integer $n$, determine if it is possible to express $n$ as a sum of multiples of 1234567, 123456, and 1234, where the coefficients are non-negative integers. 

In other words, find if there exist non-negative integers $a$, $b$, and $c$ such that:

 $$1234567a + 123456b + 1234c = n$$ 

If such integers exist, output "YES". Otherwise, output "NO".
Given a number, determine if it can be expressed as a sum of multiples of three distinct positive integers.
